fields.Title of Presentation: Blood in the Water: Rivers and Resistance in Central American Literature and Film
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Rocky Mountain Modern Language Association Annual Convention
fields.Description/Abstract: In this paper I  analyze Guatemalan author Arturo Arias’s 1979 novel Después de las bombas, Salvadoran director Luis Mandoki’s 2004 film Voces inocentes and his compatriot Mario Bencastro’s 1997 novella “Había una vez un río.” By approaching these works through the lens of trauma studies, I argue that the river in both works becomes a powerful metaphor for the psychological and physical wounds inflicted during Guatemala’s and El Salvador’s civil wars.
